intro: Galenia sarcophylla, commonly known as the red sandras. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its striking red flowers and succulent leaves. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is adapted to arid environments. Its fleshy stems and leaves store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Galenia sarcophylla is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
